conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D and needs to be traced to predict whether it flows into container E or F.
The image shows four inlet slots labeled A, B, C, and D at the top, colored baffles inclined at different angles, and two receptacles labeled E and F at the bottom.
Each baffle is colored differently: blue, gray, yellow, cyan, green, and red.
The receptacles E and F are funnel-shaped and positioned at the bottom of the image.
The tilt of each baffle guides fluid down its length toward the lower end of that strip.
The liquid from each inlet slot (A, B, C, D) will follow the successive inclined strips underneath it, deflecting left or right at each impact.
Tracing the route of liquid from each inlet slot will determine which funnel-shaped outlet it reaches at the bottom.
The last deflection of the liquid stream determines whether it flows into the left-hand receptacle (E) or the right-hand receptacle (F).
Liquid from A flows into container E.
Liquid from B flows into container E.
Liquid from C flows into container F.
Liquid from D flows into container F.
